intro: Scytalis helicopus, commonly known as the spiral grass, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to the temperate regions of the Northern Hemisphere. It is characterized by its distinctive spiral arrangement of leaves, which gives it its common name. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm and features slender, cylindrical stems. Its small, greenish-white flowers are arranged in loose panicles and bloom in late spring to early summer. Scytalis helicopus thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in meadows and along streambanks.
